 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כֶּרֶם‎</span><sub>92</sub> **noun masculine**<sup>[[Deut.28.30|Deut 28:30]]</sup> (**feminine**<sup>[[Isa.27.2|Isa 27:2]]</sup>) ==vineyard== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כַּרְמָא‎</span> <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Zinjirli <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כרם‎</span> [[BDB#DHM|DHM]]<sup>Sendsch.58</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***vine***; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***vine***; [[BDB#Jen|Jen]]<sup>ZA vii. (1892), 217</sup> compare Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***Karânu***</u></abbr>, ***vine***; — etymology dubious; [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] and others compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***noble, generous, fertile***, but precarious); — absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כ‎</span> [[Exod.22.4|Exod 22:4]] +, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּ֑רֶם‎</span> [[Gen.9.20|Gen 9:20]] +; construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כֶּרֶם‎</span> [[1Kgs.21.7|1Kgs 21:7]] +; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּרְמִי‎</span> [[Isa.5.3|Isa 5:3]] +, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּרְמְךָ‎</span> [[Exod.23.11|Exod 23:11]] +, etc.; plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּרָמִים‎</span> [[Josh.24.13|Josh 24:13]] +; construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּרְמֵי‎</span> [[Amos.5.1|Amos 5:1]] + 2 t.; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּרָמֵנוּ‎</span> [[Neh.5.3|Neh 5:3]] + 3 t.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַרְמֵיכֶם‎</span> [[Amos.4.9|Amos 4:9]] + 2 t., etc., — ***vineyard*** [[Gen.9.20|Gen 9:20]] ([[BDB#J|J]]), [[1Kgs.21.1|1Kgs 21:1]] + 9 t. [[1Kgs.21|1Kgs 21]]; [[Song.2.15|Song 2:15]] (twice in verse) +; so even [[Judg.15.5|Judg 15:5]] (where read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וזית‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָ‎</span> compare [[BDB#GFM|GFM]], who however doubts genuineness); + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זַּיִת‎</span> [[Exod.23.11|Exod 23:11]] ([[BDB#E|E]]) and often (V. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זית‎</span>); + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׂדֶה‎</span> [[Exod.22.4|Exod 22:4]]; [[Exod.22.5|Exod 22:5]] ([[BDB#E|E]]), and often; figurative of Israel under <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>'s. care [[Isa.5.1|Isa 5:1]]ff., compare [[Isa.3.14|Isa 3:14]]; [[Jer.12.10|Jer 12:10]] figurative of Shulamite's complexion [[Song.1.6|Song 1:6]], of her heart [[Song.8.12|Song 8:12]]. — Vbs. governing <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כ‎</span> are: — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָטַע‎</span> [[Gen.9.20|Gen 9:20]]; [[Amos.5.11|Amos 5:11]] + 16 t., compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַטָּעֵי כ‎</span> [[Mic.1.6|Mic 1:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זָרַע‎</span> [[Deut.22.9|Deut 22:9]] (c. 2 accusative); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חִלֵּל‎</span> = ***begin to use fruit of***, [[Deut.20.6|Deut 20:6]] (twice in verse); [[Deut.28.30|Deut 28:30]]; [[Jer.31.5|Jer 31:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זָמַר‎</span> ***prune***, [[Lev.25.3|Lev 25:3]]; [[Lev.25.4|Lev 25:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בָּצַר‎</span> ***gather, harvest*** (literally ***cut off***, i.e. grapes, [[Lev.25.5|Lev 25:5]]; [[Lev.25.11|Lev 25:11]]), [[Deut.24.21|Deut 24:21]]; [[Judg.9.27|Judg 9:27]], compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִקֵּשׁ‎</span> [[Job.24.6|Job 24:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עוֺלֵל‎</span> ***glean***, [[Lev.19.10|Lev 19:10]]; [[Deut.24.21|Deut 24:21]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָכַל‎</span> [[Josh.24.13|Josh 24:13]] (usually 'eat ***fruit*** of' [[Isa.65.21|Isa 65:21]], etc.); locusts ***devour*** [[Amos.4.9|Amos 4:9]] (si vera lectio) On **proper name, of a location** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָבֵל כְּרָמִים‎</span> see II.  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָבֵל‎</span> **4**; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בֵּית הַכֶּרֶם‎</span>.
